item.title: Ticket #7798 (tag__not_in doesn't seem to work in filters) updated
item.dc:creator: gmorehoudh
item.description:
And also with $query->set('cat', '-29');

The various methods for filtering certain posts based on tag or category appears to be totally broken in 2.6.2. I can't find any other explanation. I've deleted other category-related plugins (that weren't even active) and disabled all my other filter functions, but any time I tell Wordpress, with a filter, to exclude posts in certain categories or with certain tags, it also excludes a bunch of posts that do not meet the criteria.

item.title: Ticket #7806 (Drafts - Publish On displays date/time of last save) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Owner changed

item.title: Ticket #7806 (Drafts - Publish On displays date/time of last save) created
item.dc:creator: MtDewVirus
item.description:
In the Publish area of a post, drafts start out with "Publish immediately". After clicking the Save button (or letting auto-save fire, switching to another page, and then coming back to edit the post), the Publish area now has the text: "Publish on: September 29, 2008 at 1:49 pm" with the date of the last save.

This date/time isn't used when you click Publish, but it is misleading.

item.title: Ticket #7805 (Permalink doesn't update with new title on 'pending' posts.) created
item.dc:creator: jeremyclarke
item.description:
right now when you save a post as draft, then edit the title, the permalink is automatically changed to be the slug version of the new title. You can also manually edit it.

Once the post is published the slug is set and you have to manually change it.

However, if you save your post as 'pending' (by submitting it for review, which is what people who don't have publishing capabilities do when they use the publish button) then someone changes the title after, it doesn't alter the permalink, it keeps the slug from the old title.

So if an editor changes the title while editing the post (a common thing) they have to manually change the permalink, which is not only annoying, but confusing because they are used to how the permalinks work when they are editing their own posts, and they don't expect that it would be different.

Is this intentional? It doesn't make very much sense to me conceptually, and practically it has terrible implications (i don't even want to think about how many posts in our site have been affected by this that we just never noticed.)

I'll look into this soon anyway, but let me know if it's intended behavior (so I can debate more!)

item.title: Ticket #7804 (.htaccess file gets messed up 500 error when saving a page) created
item.dc:creator: tkolovos
item.description: I was editing a Page in the Wordpress admin panel and when I clicked Save, apparently the .htaccess file got messed up so my website gave a 500 internal error and I was unable to view my website or continue using the admin panel. I uploaded a recent good version of the .htaccess file to my website using FTP and everything was alright again. From the contents of the bad .htaccess file, it appears that Wordpress may have been trying to change the contents of that file and was unable to do so successfully because the file obviously isn't correct if you look at it. I have attached the bad .htaccess file with my ticket here.

item.title: Ticket #7803 (New Setting in Admin Section for Header/Footer Snippets) updated
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
Version, Milestone changed

Very, very easy to accomplish this via a plugin: Make super simple options page, store in db, output using hooks that are required in theme (but often do not exist).

Debatable if it's something needed in the core though. I personally don't think it really is. Heck, you just use a text widget for most of this kinda stuff.

item.title: 4832.001.diff attached to Ticket #4832
item.dc:creator: AaronCampbell

item.title: Ticket #4832 (In comments_popup_link(), why bomb out when on a page or single post?) updated
item.dc:creator: AaronCampbell
item.description:
Keywords, Milestone changed

I agree with Jeremy. I know comments_popup_link is not USUALLY used on a static page, but it seems like you should be ABLE to use it on a static page. Especially with static front pages.

I think it's rather common to have a static front page, with a small section where the most recent, most popular, or featured posts are placed. It seems like a serious waste to have to duplicate the entire function just to drop a 2 line check.

I'm attaching a patch for 2.7

Thoughts?

item.title: Ticket #7800 (Theme Directory page broken) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description: That patch adds type-checking to the function as well as just checking if the element is set.

item.title: 7800.diff attached to Ticket #7800
item.dc:creator: DD32

item.title: Ticket #7800 (Theme Directory page broken) updated
item.dc:creator: DD32
item.description:
I'm suspicious as to why the error has appeared now that the theme update stuff is in; Its caused by the Theme update checkers UI not checking the type first, But the fact your current theme doesnt have a valid stylesheet name assoc. with it, seems to say there's something else at fault (perhaps in your setup).

I would add a var_dump($theme); to line #66 of wp-admin/themes.php to check that the result from current_theme_info() is correct. eg: 

	if ( !isset($themes_update) )
		$themes_update = get_option('update_themes');
var_dump($theme);
	if ( isset($theme->stylesheet) )
		$stylesheet = $theme->stylesheet;

item.title: Ticket #7802 (404 error on new WP 2.6.2 install) created
item.dc:creator: peacelamp
item.description:
Hi, I uploaded the new webpress 2.6.2 templates after. I modified text in wp-config.php as per an older wp-config.php. I can see the folder wp-admin on my cpanel but I am unable to log into www.amandeepsandhu.com/wp-admin. I get this error:

Not Found The requested URL /wp-admin was not found on this server.

Additionally, a 404 Not Found error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.

Apache/2.0.63 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.0.63 OpenSSL/0.9.8b mod_auth_passthrough/2.1 mod_bwlimited/1.4 FrontPage/5.0.2.2635 PHP/5.2.5 Server at www.amandeepsandhu.com Port 80

Please let me know what is going wrong.

Regards, Aman
